newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling gains marginally against dollar.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling gains marginally against dollar.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling gained marginally against the dollar on Wednesday in a quiet market, dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a mean shilling rate of 55.76 against the dollar from 55.78 on Tuesday, and of 88.56 to the pound from 88.83 on Tuesday.
"There were no major movements with the shilling opening at 55.75/85 to close at 55.70/80," a commercial banker said.
Dealers said there was some activity late on Tuesday afternoon as coffee and tea dollars came into the market.
"The market is still short of shillings and we are expecting importer demand to go up," he added.
The 55.50 level remains the next support level for the dollar in the short term.
The overnight money market was tight due to tax payments and Treasury Bill outflows. Rates were quoted at 22-24 percent from 20-24 percent on Tuesday.
